publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5766 James Kelly: Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition—That the Parliament notes that the Bridgeton Burns Club recently held its annual schools concert and prize giving and offers congratulations to the schools that participated, including Calderwood Primary, St Columbkille’s Primary, Cairns Primary, Stonelaw High and James Aiton Primary, all of which work hard to keep the cause of Robert Burns alive in the 21st century.

S3M-5766 Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition (lodged on 12 February 2010) Robert Brown*, Karen Whitefield*, Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bill Butler*

S3M-5766 Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition (lodged on 12 February 2010) Stuart McMillan*, Des McNulty*, Pauline McNeill*, Jackie Baillie*, Aileen Campbell*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-5766 Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition (lodged on 12 February 2010) Hugh O’Donnell*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-5766 Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition (lodged on 12 February 2010) Hugh Henry*, Trish Godman*
S3M-5766 Rutherglen and Cambuslang Schools Success in Bridgeton Burns Club Competition (lodged on 12 February 2010) Marilyn Livingstone*
